Package xyz.acygn.mokapot.util

Utility functions used by the distributed communication system.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DeterministicAutocloseable
    Wrapper around AutoCloseable with tighter guarantees on exceptions.
    Expirable
    An interface describing objects that can be atomically "effectively deallocated" even while there are still references to them.
    Expirable.ExpirableMethod<A extends Expirable,R>
    An interface representing a method that can be called on an Expirable object and that has a return value.
    Expirable.ExpirableVoidMethod<A extends Expirable>
    An interface representing a method that can be called on an Expirable object and that has no return value.
    ThreadUtils.InterruptiblyRunnable
    A functional interface representing operations that can potentially be interrupted.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArrayWrapper<T>
    A class that acts, in most respects, identically to a Java array.
    AutocloseableLockWrapper
    A simple utility class that acquires a lock when constructed, and releases it when autoclosed.
    BackgroundGarbageCollection
    A utility class for performing garbage collection and finalisation on a background thread.
    CrossThreadReadWriteLock
    A read/write lock in which locking isn't tied to a thread.
    DataByteBuffer
    A ByteBuffer wrapped to implement (most of) the DataInput and DataOutput interfaces.
    ExpirableMap<K,V extends Expirable>
    A map for which the values are Expirable, and automatically created when required.
    ExtendedList<T>
    An immutable list that's formed by adding one element to the end of an existing list.
    JoinablePooledThread<T>
    A PooledThread which additionally supports a join() operation and optional return value.
    KeepalivePool<K extends Expirable>
    An object which allows other objects to hold themselves alive for a given length of time.
    MutexPool<K>
    A "keyed" mutex; each thread specifies a key when locking the mutex, and two threads can access the mutex concurrently as long as they specify different keys.
    ObjectIdentity<T>
    An object that represents another object's identity; that is, the value of the object's identity is the object itself.
    ObjectMethodDatabase<T>
    A listing of all the methods (and fields, and classes) that exist on objects which have a given actual class.
    PooledThread
    A Thread-like object that executes using a thread pool, rather than as a thread of its own.
    ResettableThreadLocal<T>
    An object that conceptually holds a different value on different threads, but where a "thread" can be a subset of a Java thread.
    StringifyUtils
    Utilities for converting arbitrary objects to strings in a better way than Object#toString.
    ThreadUtils
    Utility class for threading-related static methods.
    TypeSafe
    Utility class containing type-safe re-implementations of some of Java's non-type-safe reflection APIs.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    BackgroundGarbageCollection.Operation
    A garbage-collection-related operation that can be done in the background.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AutocloseableLockWrapper.CannotLockException
    An exception thrown if a lock cannot be locked immediately.
    Expirable.ExpiredException
    Exception thrown when an attempt is made to call a method on an expired object.

Package xyz.acygn.mokapot.util Description

Utility functions used by the distributed communication system.

The classes and methods in this package are effectively independent of the parent package, and each stand on their own. This package therefore basically exists as a place to write small library-style routines that were needed in the creation of the distributed communication system, and which were too small to warrant the inclusion of an external library.
